reviews.text: A nice spot to visit. You have to be a bit careful with traffic that passes through and in some ways, the cars on the street take away a bit from general ambiance. Worth a quick stop.
Beautifully scenic area! The house shine bright in all different colors, making it a wonderful photo spot. I can also recommend a free walking tour to learn a bit more about the history.

Before you walk around Bo Kaap, start at the museum first. It's small and won't take up too much time, but it will certainly give you a revered perspective of what the whole area, those phenomenal colours and the friendly residents stand for and how important the history is. In a city that has been taken over by modernity and lost a lot of distinguishing features, Bo Kaap's rich culture and history is a magical tonic. Also the Cape Georgian architecture of the buildings is worth the journey alone! I'm extremely surprised it's not a World Heritage site!

The quaint, colourful houses with narrow streets were the highlight of this visit for me. Great for landscape photos. I also spotted a 'Fatima mini market'. The vibe from the residents wasn't too welcoming though in spite of the heavy tourist presence....

Haven't been to the museum but loved the place. Beautiful home who need to be protected. And please be nice and stop SEATING on others properties and putting YOUR FEET all their WALL. this is not your Instagram wall

Being a centrepiece of South Africa's Dutch/Colonial history, you would expect a greater emphasis on historical Dutch/Colonial figures. Unfortunately, it seems that the history focuses more on the African prisoners who were kept there. Even the flags of the Netherlands, France and England have been taken down with only the South African flag remaining. It is now a representation of how politics can affect a country's "history". The exhibits that are on show are well kept and well maintained. Most of the staff were very friendly and informative.

Great guides and good facilities. Military presence always so really safe. Great curios shop and awesome Canon presentations. Can't believe they achieved this so long ago. Wish to see the original close to shore however washed away long ago.

Go when weather is nice. Really recommend it. Madiba building with city hall really close to it including the luxurious waterfront.
Must see
I can recommend the free walking tour and the firing of the canon. Both were very informative and entertaining at the same time. The museums could be more interactive and better connected.
Lovely place to look at history and just see where the colonism all started. It's great to go to the dungeons and see how dark and cold they were. Great venue for other events too..

Lots to see and explore. Every open door you can enter so after a guided tour this is so much fun. The tour guides are friendly and very informative. I would definitely recommend this as a fun thing to do with your kids that isn't expensive.
It is a quiet place, rich of a profound presence of loneliness and struggle. I made a visit to always remember how difficult can be Freedom.

A lot of history kept alive on this island. Well maintained and enjoyed the prison tour which was given by an ex prisoner on the same island. Lot of political prisoners spent their time here. There is a cruise service to this place which is always heavily booked. The experience is very nice.

This is a must see. If you ever have the opertunity to go, it is a must. Special shout out to Nozuko who was a brilliant tour guide!!!! She kept us entertained and really know what she is talking about!
Such an amazing tour of history!!  I believe everyone should visit here
This needs to be one of the first places to visit in cape town. Its a really interesting tour that helfs you immerse yourself in south africa's history

Another petrol price hike on the cards. Jobless rate keeps on rising. Crime is out of control. VAT rises. Can't even supply potable water or protect it's citizens. Keep it up. Service delivery is a joke. Keep it up. South-Africa will just become another failed state. Not to mention farm murders out of control. A useless public health sector. The list get's longer, as the country is being destroyed. But politicians live in luxury, have the best in life. Not the dream that late Mr Nelson Mandela had for the rainbow nation.
Its is an amazing place with our history beautiful views mountain and emagenable statues of our late President's its just loveable
Awesome old building. Please Ramaposa get rid of the zupta fools&thieves.
Best view great building.I just have love of this place
It was amazing

The iconic V&A waterfront is full of top notch eateries, shops and galleries. The food market is fantastic and the kids play area is amazing.  The big wheel is pretty awesome but obviously doesn't almost compare with its big cousins like the London Eye. Place gets busy during peak times and parking can be a hassle even though there are several parking buildings. You can go on boat rides, see fur seals, visit the Aquarium... easily spending an entire day or more here.

Beautiful venue for tourists. Family friendly there are plenty of restaurants and other activities. They usually have special events happening at the water front. You can get a boat to Robin Island and enjoy a tour of the island. You can watch a movie, go onto the Ferris wheel and you can have amazing pictures for your social media.

I love the fact that this mall was up and running even during load shedding because it seems they have a good amount of solar panels installed. This mall is also pretty due to the design and beautiful scenery around it. Parking is a bit of a challenge since there is never ample space here. But it is a great place to visit in the heart of the city

One of my fave malls in Cape Town ...... love it to bits. Live entertainment. Best food places to find.....I aim to try a new one every other month. Right on harbour. You can take boat trips,helicopter trips,big wheel,sightseeing bus,aquarium, etc. The finest hotels are just there........most definitely the place to be

This place has a wonderful atmosphere. Feels incredibly high end and safe with security presence dotted all around the area. There is a mixture of high end shopping malls and more boutique offerings. A few tourist trap style restaurants but even these don't break the bank. Surrounding the area are great high end hotels such as The Silo and The One and Only. And all the while you are in the shadow of Table Mountain. It feels rather magical.
A nice spot to visit. You have to be a bit careful with traffic that passes through and in some ways, the cars on the street take away a bit from general ambiance. Worth a quick stop.
Beautifully scenic area! The house shine bright in all different colors, making it a wonderful photo spot. I can also recommend a free walking tour to learn a bit more about the history.

Before you walk around Bo Kaap, start at the museum first. It's small and won't take up too much time, but it will certainly give you a revered perspective of what the whole area, those phenomenal colours and the friendly residents stand for and how important the history is. In a city that has been taken over by modernity and lost a lot of distinguishing features, Bo Kaap's rich culture and history is a magical tonic. Also the Cape Georgian architecture of the buildings is worth the journey alone! I'm extremely surprised it's not a World Heritage site!

The quaint, colourful houses with narrow streets were the highlight of this visit for me. Great for landscape photos. I also spotted a 'Fatima mini market'. The vibe from the residents wasn't too welcoming though in spite of the heavy tourist presence....

Haven't been to the museum but loved the place. Beautiful home who need to be protected. And please be nice and stop SEATING on others properties and putting YOUR FEET all their WALL. this is not your Instagram wall

This is one of the most beautiful wine farms in South Africa. You should surely add it to your list of favorite places to visit. Wine is delicious, you can have a guided tour. There are 2 restaurants to choose from, and the views are absolutely beautiful.
Great people. Excellent service. Feels like home 'cause whenever I get there I feel welcome. Nice views too... The tour is very educational, do consider it if you go there.
I love visiting this great estate with its amazing history. Definitely a must visit location when in Cape Town.

The place was of particular interest to me due to a poem I did in primary school. It was fascinating to put a picture and history to something that was only imagined before. It has stunning views of mountains and vineyards. It is very peaceful, gives one a feeling of being close to nature.

Visited The Groot Constantia Wine Estate today. 
The oldest wine-producing farm in South Africa. 
They also offer Yoga on the lawns🧘🏽‍♀️
Very emotional and yet so much rich history one can learn from this place, worth checking out when in Cape Town.
Pleasant and informative. Kids enjoyed the tour because they were active participants throughout
Very interesting displays. Both audio and visual.

Unfortunately they would not allow me in because I refuse to record  my identification number on their paper. I showed them identification but still refused. 
Couldn't give an answer why they wanted my identity number. 
Interestingly, they allowed Jewish people in without filling out details.

Great explanation about the creation of a Jewish community in South Africa. Very modern and with a lot of unusual details, like the reconstruction of a Lithuanian shtetl, a typical Jewish village from the country that brought around 40.000 Jews to South Africa. Definitely worth a visit.

A place where you can see different types of arts, crafts. Paintings, wood works, historical crafts and many more. A must visit place. The staffs are helpful and photography allowed. Usually not very crowded and you can enjoy the exhibits peacefully. It is very close to the museum and entry free if you have ticket for the museum.

This was a nice way to spend an hour or so, my wife and I attended on our last day in Cape Town as the gallery was quite close to where we were staying. There were some thought provoking pieces and of course the focus on African art is always welcome.
Such a lovely place to spend your free time. Its so affordable and a great cultural experience. Student pay less on friday.

The most boring collection of "art" that I've ever seen. Pictures of dogs and people skateboarding. I can literally see all of that on Instagram. I really thought I'd see old and life changing art but it's nothing special. If this is our national gallery then we have no hope. I didn't feel any emotion and most of the art is not even 20 years old. Very disappointed. I definitely won't be coming here again.
Free on public holidays. My first gallery visit and loved the variety of artwork on display. 10/10 would go again.

If u want some good music theather performance & stories of Cape Town than this is the place. Food options is limited because it buffet & there is not a lot of variety. Having said that the food served is traditional cape Malay & south African which is really good. The performance from the artists is simply fantastic & will take one away to a different period in time. One should go there at least once to experience it.

Kaapse stories was amazing, what a fantastic performance. They need to improve the food serving situation, instead of a buffet rather serve platters on the table that people at the table can dish from.

Other than that, I can see they have invested quite a bit into the place from when they started. Still the best theatre in Cape town.

The food was good.
The singer's voices were good, especially the opera singer and the main woman.
I couldn't follow the story line.
The show has great potential, if they can build a suitable narrative around the songs
Nice , small intimate theatre and the food was good. The cost was very affordable.

Great besides the orange juice shower caused by the waitstress. No apology for ruining my clothes or a way to dry /wipe myself. Floor was cleaned only. Food was absolutely amazing. Show was spectacular and fun as well.

The theatre is not named after a vagina, it's named after Countess Labia, a well-known Cape patron of the arts from the last century. The movies are individually curated by the owner, who is not affiliated to any movie house or big movie chain  He makes excellent, bang-on choices and he doesn't screen rubbish. He is often present personally and I hope he lives forever - or at least, as long as I do. The theatre itself is an unmissable experience, quite apart from any movie. The place has such a loyal following that I saw a local walk up to the ticket kiosk, lay down his money and then ask, "what's showing today?" The staff are genuine, home-grown locals, totally eccentric, and they've probably worked there all their lives. Don't be put off by their slightly "off" looks. That's what "genuine" means. Go already, for Gd's sake!

Old world charm and good movies. It's refreshing to experience this than the commercial theaters. The week specials combined with some restaurants and coffee shops makes it a very good value proposition. The theatres  don't have the latest sound systems, but it is good enough.

An independent Cinema (of which there are so few these days). Situated on a busy road, parking can be quite an issue. I would recommend an lift service to get you there. On entering, there is a lovely veranda with hanging plants and shaded seating. On offer in terms of drinks and snacks...everything you could want (pies, wine, coffee, popcorn, choc brownies etc). The cinema staff are friendly and operate at their own pace (this adds to the charm). The cinemas themselves have comfortable seats, good picture and sounds quality. One may take drinks and food inside. TIP try the dinner and movie special for two, great value and very convenient as the restaurants associated are within walking distance of the Labia. Enjoy!

The Labia theater is a must visit if you have not already been. The old type cinema experience makes you feel like you entered a different era and I love that and the best part is you can take your wine into the cinema. Its way less than the movies at the malls and pop corn is only 10 bucks. They also play some really cool South African films too.
Fantastic little theatre. Great prices, great food and drinks and a fun vibe. I love coming here instead of SK or nu metro.

The theatre is not named after a vagina, it's named after Countess Labia, a well-known Cape patron of the arts from the last century. The movies are individually curated by the owner, who is not affiliated to any movie house or big movie chain  He makes excellent, bang-on choices and he doesn't screen rubbish. He is often present personally and I hope he lives forever - or at least, as long as I do. The theatre itself is an unmissable experience, quite apart from any movie. The place has such a loyal following that I saw a local walk up to the ticket kiosk, lay down his money and then ask, "what's showing today?" The staff are genuine, home-grown locals, totally eccentric, and they've probably worked there all their lives. Don't be put off by their slightly "off" looks. That's what "genuine" means. Go already, for Gd's sake!

Old world charm and good movies. It's refreshing to experience this than the commercial theaters. The week specials combined with some restaurants and coffee shops makes it a very good value proposition. The theatres  don't have the latest sound systems, but it is good enough.

On entering, there is a lovely veranda with hanging plants and shaded seating. On offer in terms of drinks and snacks...everything you could want (pies, wine, coffee, popcorn, choc brownies etc). The cinema staff are friendly and operate at their own pace (this adds to the charm). The cinemas themselves have comfortable seats, good picture and sounds quality. One may take drinks and food inside. TIP try the dinner and movie special for two, great value and very convenient as the restaurants associated are within walking distance of the Labia. Enjoy!

The Labia theater is a must visit if you have not already been. The old type cinema experience makes you feel like you entered a different era and I love that and the best part is you can take your wine into the cinema. Its way less than the movies at the malls and pop corn is only 10 bucks. They also play some really cool South African films too.
Fantastic little theatre. Great prices, great food and drinks and a fun vibe. I love coming here instead of SK or nu metro.

Are you tired and don't feel like cooking... visit Eastern Food Bazaar.
The furniture is well set out with beautiful wood cravings for the enthusiasts to feast their eyes on. Have a look around it was set out for you.

Take time to sit down and enjoy a home cooked meal. My favourite is the Lamb curry and gosh.
There is a wide variety of choices so don't be in too much of a hurry to order.  Look at the menu and ask questions.
Their ice cream is divine. I also enjoy the coffee very much. You may sit in to enjoy your meal or order to take away. 
The management and staff are very friendly and very helpful.

Great place to grab a bite! This place has a variety of different foods to choose from. The whole process is pretty speedy. Lots of seating available usually. Very impressed with the value of the food. You get a good amount of really good food for a great value! A have been several times and have never been disappointed. If you are in Cape Town, stop by and have some great food!

Very good food, large portions for very little. 
The food is not the hottest nor the best Indian food that I have had. 

But definitely the best value for money Indian food in Cape Town.

I highly recommend giving them it a visit as the atmosphere is great, and unlike anything else in Cape Town!

Best Eastern food. I can't handle it too spicy, but the flavors are there. Whenever I smell curry, I think of Eastern Food Bizarre. Very relaxed environment. Service is fast. Pricing is definitely affordable.

This place is great and authentic. The food is amazing and very affordable. There is also a big variety to choose from - Indian, Chinese, Turkish, Italian. The portion sizes are huge and I can easily eat twice from one meal. It's a food market and quite basic (plastic cutlery, sit anywhere etc) but the food is fantastic and it gives a really authentic experience coming here. Would totally choose this over a fancy and expensive restaurant. Note that it's open so keep an eye on your belongings with you as a friendly note (there are also signs up everywhere that says this).
I really like tte rooftop view. I think it is spectacular

The restuarant was great, but there are places you can eat at a way better price. The the stay here is extremely overpriced with no amenities. There are cheaper places in town where you can have internet, aircon, parking, and even cable.
Good guesthouse to stay at for affordable prices
Great place to relax after a long day of work in CPT...
Amazing environment, great cafè with the most delicious meals served in the village

Some friends & I decided to go to an early dinner before going to the  theatre & one of the group suggested Col'Cacchio at the foreshore in Cape Town.
We arrived & we where seated outside by friendly smiling waiters.
We placed our orders & I ordered the lamb shrank, thought to myself let's see what they're going to do with one of my favoured dishes.
Well it arrived & I was gobbed smacked by the presentation & sublime taste, the best I've ever had.
What a little gem in our City, you will be seeing us again.
To the management and staff thank you for a great experience.
Kind regards
Ferdie Liebenberg

I am a regular visitor to Col’Cacchio in Pretoria. This was my first visit to a Cape Town Col’Cacchio. To my surprise the service was swift and friendly. The waiter asked if I would like to add capers to my regular choice of pizza and I did. What a good choice!! It added a new flavour dimension to the dish. Well done to the team at Col’Cacchio Foreshore. I will make sure to drop by when I am in the City again! 👏

The first Col’caccio (in a now successful franchise) always dishes up the best. Light, wood-fired pizza bases topped with fresh, quality ingredients are always winners and their generous salads creatively combine some unusual ingredients. They are consistently busy but take reservations only for groups of seven and more. Still, if you need to wait for a table you can do so at the bar.
Tastes Good, but was to crowded. We could not reach them by phone for an hour and had to go and give our order Personally. But we liked the Pizza much.
The best staff,great service and pizza's to die for. Absolute must try for everyone who hasn't been there yet. You will simply enjoy everything about the meal and place itself. Bravo!
Good, solid, ethical, affordable legal advice!

One of best Italian restaurants in Cape Town.  White Table Cloths and napkins. Very good service and tranquil atmosphere makes dinning here a pleasurable experience. Prices a little on the high side but it is good quality for the cost. Very good wine list. A restaurant always worth a visit on special occasions.
Very well designed restaurant with excellent food and very friendly staff! We had an awesome time there! p.s. try the gorgonzola gnocchi, easily the best I ever had!
I liked the setting. Staff were super helpful and knowledgeable. I particularly liked the steak though the fish on polenta was tasty.
Gnocchi with gorgonzola, so delicious. Service took some time to Be good, but nice ambiance.
Good food, good service. Some good Italian dishes.
Beautiful city view over drinks and food
Best shisha lounge and whiskey bar in town!!! And bonus the food is to die for and kitchen closes at 2am!

The vibe is awesome and well ventilated (open space). Could work best to increase the Hookah sitting area and sort out the 'members' area by partitioning it from the restrooms. 

Increase the drinks variety and stock more local stuff.

Awesome friendly but firm personnel.
Good music. Great for pre-drinks before a night out.
Amazing food and drinks... Plus shisha pipes available
Stonebreakers restaurant has good food, friendly staff and a beautiful view of table mountain and the waterfront. Will definitely go there again.

Quality not quantity.

Great buffet  , with delicious food.

The staff was extremely helpful and friendly.

We will be back...
Great service professional staff good food
Food is good, service is excellent. Not suitable for children. The view from our table
Food was very nice and healthy.  Service was excellent. I would recommend it
Wanted to try their restaurant but unfortunately it's closed down.
It looks unattractive outside but inside it's nice,beautiful &attractive. .
It was good but not great
We loved staying here. Great breakfasts and rooms. You cannot go wrong.
Dinner at the revolving restaurant a must. Fine dining with views of the city changing whilst you eat

Consistently good Chinese takeaways and really great sushi. I love the sweet and sour pork with rice, and the calamari chow main is always good. Service is usually good, and you'll wait around 10 - 15 minutes for your order.
Been coming here for a couple months. Good value for money. Sushi special is great.
They always seem to have customers so the food can't be that bad. The spicy beef is nice
As a family of 4 we were highly impressed by the quality and taste of their food.  We visited them 3 times during our 5 day stay. We wish they would open a branch in Randburg Johannesburg 😁🤤
Totally your money's worth, nice vibe, friendly service great ocean view.
Great value for money
Exceptional Stay @ Ocean View Hotel
Amazing View. Right next to a beach!
Unfriendly staff. Unhelpful
Staff get 10 stars. Always friendly and willing to go the extra mile. One of my favourite get away as it's close enough to CT

Lovely place to enjoy a beautiful sunset dinner. The staff are so courteous.. the food was so tasteful!! WOW... bursts of flavour.

I will definitely go there again!
Most succulent and tasty roast lamb ever. Well worth the recommendation!!! Will buy again.
Lovely venue and friendly staff. Grilled calamari exceptionally delicious.

If your kind of vibe is elegant and beautiful ambience combined with stellar customer service then this is your place. 

The food leaves your palette tantalized and your tummy screaming for more. Not to mention - the servings' portions are big. Satiety creeped in right after my starter.

We came for a "complementary" dinner from one of the sunset cruises we went on, almost 3 years ago. 
Being Greeks, we didn't really have any options. 
We were so happy, that we ended up coming back every other day for the duration of our holiday. The staff were really very friendly, the food was amazing, the service was out standing. We really had no complaints. And being in the hospitality industry myself (and my girlfriend) we couldn't really fault the place. We are headed back here next week. Can't wait...

The service is excellent, manager was constantly checking up on us (he's cute also). It's a great place for a relaxed evening out with friends/family. However the food was insipid, my friend had the seafood pizza and I had the seafood pasta... maybe invest in another chef, otherwise the overall experience was a good one. Also the cocktails are delicious.
Lovely views, friendly management & stuff...had the pasta with salmon which was around R180 bit steep for pasta but it was OK...average size portion....
Terrific traditional Italian wood-fired oven pizza with a great view over the waterfront.
Best Carbonara in Cape Town. Excellent service. Pasta dessert well worth the weight gain
Great place. A little bit on the pricey side but the food is excellent and the staff are well trained

This is an experience not to be missed! The ambience, food and wine were all superb. I can see why they are consistently voted the best restaurant in South Africa. I would say that I will be back but it's pricey! And further to that, it's a unique experience that I feel one shouldn't try and replicate. Our party elected the Iconic wine pairing, which was amazing, although after the first few wines, the sommelier stopped telling us about the wines, which was a pity. But overall this was still a 5 star experience.

Well deserved world class ranking, the two stage approach really makes for a unique and extremely rewarding experience. Beautifully paced service with extreme attention to detail and no pretentious overtones. The second stage in the main dining area was as good as the first, there is no need to describe the food; the taste, visual and texture do not compare to a normal dining experience. A definite bucket list restaurant.

I cannot find words for the fantastic evening we had. The quality, love for detail and yet the taste is simply incredible. Every bite offered a new world of flavors. The iconic wine pairing was just outstanding. The wines itself were fantastic but together with the corresponding dishes it was just perfect - it complemented every dish so well. The dinner in The Test Kitchen was such an amazing experience and we will recommend it to every person we know. And for sure we will come back as well. Thanks to the team for the amazing job you do!
Best in class. Been to more than 30 restaurants in CPT. This, is by far  the best! Food and service are top notch

I would love to write a review of the food but sadly I can only write about the incomprehensible on line booking policy: we are told we cannot book for a following month until 8.30 am on the first on the month before. So how is it that, 14 hours before that allotted time, the restaurant is fully booked for February? I had my hotel standing by to book at exactly 8.30 am - and, to be sure, my partner poised in London at 6.30 am - but they tell me it is fully booked the day before that time.
Perhaps they only take reservations from locals or regulars and not (regular)  visitors from London. In which case I guess I'm happy not to be dining there. The single star rating is merely to get readers' attention.

Chilled pub, great to watch a sports game or just have a relaxed bite to eat while chatting. They have a nice bar area and smoking area. And you are bound to have a good time there. The staff there are really fun and have such wonderful personalities.

Good day Royal Oak what a plate of good food as always even with  load shedding 
Love and Blessings 
SANDRA Seebregts (Mr Loubser)
A long-standing and pretty convincing approximation of a traditional English pub. Food wasn't bad. Local crowd, many of them ex-pats. Friendly owners.
Cheapish and cheerful for a quick pub lunch. Good food
Very good food. Cosy pub
I really like tte rooftop view. I think it is spectacular

The restuarant was great, but there are places you can eat at a way better price. The the stay here is extremely overpriced with no amenities. There are cheaper places in town where you can have internet, aircon, parking, and even cable.
Good guesthouse to stay at for affordable prices
Great place to relax after a long day of work in CPT...
Amazing environment, great cafè with the most delicious meals served in the village
